title: deseretnews.com | LDS leaders given regrets  in person
subject: Story from deseretnews.com, the Web edition of Deseret Morning News. - Seeking to send a message about the dangers of intolerance and religious bigotry, Illinois state government officials expressed their regrets in person Wednesday to top leaders of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints nearly 160 years after persecution eventually drove some 20,000 early Latter-day Saints from their homes beginning in 1846.
